page.title: 19EYEMOUTH HARBOUR
page.content: Eyemouth has had a harbour since the 12th C.It lies at the mouth of the River Eye and is well sheltered from sea storms by a natural bay.The entrance is very narrow and is known locally by the fishermen as the "canyon".Today the harbour has some 60 seine-net fishing boats,20 smaller boats fishing mainly for crabs and lobsters and some 10 pleasure craft and yachts.On one side of the harbour is an all weather fish market where daily are auctioned boxes of cod,haddock and whiting.Around the harbour are a variety of services for the repair of the boats, their engines and electronic equipment.Occasionally the harbour has to be dredged of the sand and mud brought down by the River Eye.
